title: Bug 49195: Using 1 as shutdown port with Windows service works, but prints error message
description: Specify <Server port="1" in server.xml3. That can be used to differentiate the two use cases.There could be improvements on how to stop Tomcat. System.exit(0) would work regardless of all that.I suppose that jsvc may show the same behaviour, but I have not tried.
OB: When using Tomcat as a Windows service and specifying 1 as the shutdown port in the server.xml configuration file, the service starts successfully but prints an error message.
EB: The error message should not be printed when using 1 as the shutdown port with a Windows service.
SR: To reproduce the issue: Install Tomcat as a service on Windows. Start the service, and then stop the service. Shutdown the server through an OS signal, like calling Catalina.stop().
